job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Palm Springs, CA
pros: Pay. Your coworkers become part of your family. The medical benefits were good.
cons: For so many years, our department had our ups and downs; just like any company . The past 3 years, we had a new RT manager who came on with no experience. HR and administration were aware about her, and still did nothing. Over 20 therapists have quit since her arrival. The morale has gone down. The bullying and the retaliation from her when speaking up about something important became unbearable. We weren't even allowed to laugh in the lunch room. The entire experience there under her management felt like the gestapo. I dont think the hospital understands the concept, "take care of your employees, and your employees will take care of you"...Many therapists there ended up going on a leave of absence because the stress with her was just too much. The people that have stayed there , have stayed because of the benefits.

job_title: ICU RN in Palm Springs, CA
pros: When working in this hospital's ICU, you will receive very critical, complex patients and be required to work in all the pods, MedSurg, Neuro, Cardiac and Trauma. This is where you get excellent experience, typically an ICU nurse is dedicated to one ICU where they specialize. Not here! You are very knowledgeable and marketable when going elsewhere after working here. Union hospital, but representation is not the greatest.
cons: You will be called into the office for every little detail, micromanaging at it's finest. They scrutinize you. Management is terrible, they do not have leadership qualities. Quick to anger, volatile personalities, apathetic and cold. Older nurses use lateral violence and team is very "clicky." The orientation is a joke. They expect you to know how to do everything and know every policy after 8 weeks of "training." Management are the puppets of the CNO because they do whatever is asked, with no regard to backing up their nurses. Terrible CEO and CNO. It's all about money with this place. Especially after COVID- they rationed their PPE and hid it from employees. Absolutely shameful.

job_title: ICU RN in Palm Springs, CA
pros: Nursing bedside staff are all friendly, for the most part. Great pay.
cons:
Management does not care about the employees and just their productivity. You must clock in at
7:00 exactly. If it is 7:01, you will be talked to or written up and its never acceptable. Constant micromanagement. They encourage paperwork and documentation over good patient care. You are always doing something wrong and the physicians are allowed to cause issues and disrespect the nurses without recourse. Management does NOT protect its nurses from physicians, Physicians fight in the units where both staff and patients can hear.

job_title: Healthcare Staff in Palm Springs, CA
pros: I really have nothing to say at least the upper managers don't call you a racist name to your face.
cons: I have worked here for 3 years and I have seem many employees leave and upper manager have made it difficult for people to do their jobs. I'm a father of 4 girls and the things I have witness against new female staff I have no words. The females that have left without going to bed with men that has made it hard for them, these same men will go out of way to make sure that these women can't get another job anywhere else. Please if you are reading this do not take a job here if you are a female or a person color you will not be treated will at ALL

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Palm Springs, CA
pros: Decent benefits, beautiful location and accomplished hospital.  Executive leadership was great to work with.  Lean focused.  Collaborative environment.  Hospital was very involved in the community.

job_title: Surgical Technologist in Palm Springs, CA
pros: A lot of good people to work with. Good training through Traumas.
cons:
Management. Pay is junk even in a Union environment (Unless you're a RN in their union). Union does not exist physically, they do not represent nor do they support you. Dept is totally run on the fly. No organization. Equipment needs to be updated. Instrument Trays need to be re-evaluated and set up more realistically to today's procedures. A lot of potential but no initiative. 
Management does not support staff.

review_title: Great benefits but very stressful.  Crazy hours but you learn lots of things.
